conclusion: The horizontal conveyor belt is moving clockwise at a speed of v=6 m/s. The distance between the two drive wheels M and N is L1=10 m. The object has mass m=3 kg and is placed on the conveyor belt directly above wheel M. The coefficient of kinetic friction between the object and the conveyor belt is μ=0.3.

premise: The frictional force f acting on the object is given by f = μmg.
conclusion: Substituting the given values, f = 0.3 × 3 kg × 10 m/s² = 9 N.

premise: The acceleration a of the object due to this frictional force is a = f/m.
The object starts from rest and accelerates until it reaches the speed of the conveyor belt v = 6 m/s. The time t it takes to reach this speed is given by v = at.
The distance d traveled by the object while accelerating is given by d = 1/2 at².
The total distance between the two wheels is L1 = 10 m. After accelerating for 6 meters, the object travels the remaining distance at the constant speed of the conveyor belt.
conclusion: d_remaining = L1 - d = 10 m - 6 m = 4 m.

premise: The work W done by the frictional force is the product of the frictional force and the distance over which it acts. Since the frictional force acts only during the acceleration phase (6 meters), the work done is W = f × d.
